Description: Body sherd of North Ionian pottery bird bowl (?); interior: glazed with two added red bands lined in white; reserved circle in the centre; exterior: partly preserved voided base-rays.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Marked in ink on exterior: "Naukratis. G. J. Chester , 1885".
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (IID, pl. I, 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.088)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
